messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:56): when parsing a URL, how do you canonicalize the port?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (04:57): On the basis of the scheme?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (04:57): Or am I missing something?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:07): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: dunno
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:07): it's missing from abarth URL parsing draft
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:07): http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-abarth-url-01#section-5
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:08): he has "If the canonicalized-port is non-empty and is not the default port for the scheme"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:08): which is the part you mean, I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:08): so that's clear
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:09): but that step is done after the port is "canonicalized"
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:09): port - one of the few pieces of a URL that people seem to agree on for the most part
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:09): yeah
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:09): port or port number
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:09): or if you're a PHP person, SERVER_PORT
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:09): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, you've seen this right? http:/ f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905.com/2011/238/b1/many-ways-slice-url-name-pieces
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:10): so not clear to me, given just a port number without knowledge of the scheme, what exactly do I do to canonicize it?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:10): looks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:10): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905: ah yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:10): that's quite a diagram
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:11): abarth introduces the term "after-scheme" for all the stuff collectively that is not the scheme
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:11): I like that
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:11): I have two more rows to add too
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:12): oh great
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:12): make that 3
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:12): is this an RFC track thing? draft-abarth-url-01
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:12): in which case, maybe I'll wait until there's a permalinkable spec for it
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:13): since IETF doesn't seem to believe in permalinks for drafts
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (05:13): the tools.ietf.org/html/ links are pretty much stable
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (05:13): The actual drafts vanish after 90 days, but they stay around there forever :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (05:14): GO LOGIC!
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): that ID is being not being maintained any longer
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): so it won't move forward at the IETF
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): our plan is to put all the URL stuff into a single spec
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): and publish it at W3C
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:14): will await a permalink for that spec then
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:15): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905: http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/url/raw-file/tip/Overview.html
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:15): I am working on it as we speak
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:16): just taking the work that abarth has already done and combining into it one doc, along with some bits from the HTML spec
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:17): so the plan is for this doc to to have the definition of "URL" and "valid URL", then algorithms for dealing with URLs, then the URL API
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:17): ah - looks like the terms are a re-use of 1996 DOM window.location
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (05:17): so that's good, not a new terminology at least
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:18): well, none of it is set in stone of course
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:19): the main goal for now is to get it all in one place and then get it out for review
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:19): and the high-level goal is to "get it right"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:19): including to have it actually reflect reality
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:20): or realities plural
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:20): in that the browser behavior for URL parsing it not completely interoperable
